CLOSING.
DOCTOR AND MILA/CHARLEY ARE LAUGHING, EXHAUSTED AFTER A HOLIDAY ON GRALISTA.
MILA/CHARLEY: You look ridiculous in that hat, it’s brilliant!

THEY BOTH LAUGH ABOUT IT. THEY’VE HAD A GREAT TIME.
But why do we have to leave now? I feel like I could spend my life on Gralista!
Oh, we’ll come back, don’t worry. I like to pop in on Gralista Social from time to time... although... it’s funny... I can’t actually remember when I was last here. Hmmm...
MILA/CHARLEY: So where to now?
Well... I promised you a trip to Earth, didn’t I?
MILA/CHARLEY: That was ages ago... and you did say we were going the long way round!
Yes, Charley, but it’s been an extremely long way round, hasn’t it?
MILA/CHARLEY: I suppose it has, really. So... Earth, then?

5. BLUE FORGOTTEN PLANET PROGRAMME.
FORGOTTEN PLANET PROGRAMME ‘THEME’. [HEARTFELT
FADE UP UNDERNEATH, A COLD, LONELY WIND BLOWING.

So, this is the blue planet you’ve forgotten about. But take another look. You helped us once. I know you can help us again. Just look at what’s happened here... The way everything’s fallen apart... Look at my people. Lost, starving, dying... Unable to help themselves... Wandering the planet with only fear and corrosive rage as their constant companions.
We are truly grateful for what you’ve done to help us.

We wouldn’t still be here if it wasn’t for you. But look closer. Look at our faces. Look into our eyes. We need so much more from you. We need you to help again and carry on helping. Without you, the human race will die out. And Planet Earth will surely be our tomb.

6. INT. EDIT SUITE. COMPOUND.
APPLAUSE AND MUTTERS OF APPRECIATION.
[ADDRESSING A GROUP] Really nice, that’s really nice. Good work on the music, too. All we need now is the new footage.
KNOCK.

Er.. be with you all in a moment, folks. [MOVING CLOSE, SOTTO] Did you... say anything about—?

[SOTTO] So you told him?

Yeah. Sure.

MILA/CHARLEY : What was that radiation stuff we went through, and how come it wiped— ?

The memory banks? Luckily, the TARDIS is far too clever to let that happen permanently. But it’ll take her a while to sort it out. And I’ve no idea at all what that radiation— Wait a minute, what’s that? Can you see it?
MILA/CHARLEY: Um... where? Oh... That sort of dark patch over there?
Blue Forgotten Planet — by Nicholas Briggs.
Mm. Let’s go and take a look, shall we?
SOUND OF DAVID’S JET HELICOPTER.
MILA/CHARLEY: Sssh! Listen. What is that?
Sounds like.. some sort of jet engine?
MILA/CHARLEY: Did they have those in the 1930s?
Not so’s you’d notice. Still, one thing at a time,
Charlotte. Come on.

HELICOPTER LANDS. AS THE ENGINES WIND DOWN, THE CRUNCH OF MILITARY, JOGGING FOOTSTEPS ON CONCRETE. THE RATTLE OF MILITARY GEAR ON THE SOLDIERS APPROACHING.

DOWN METAL LADDER FROM SHUTTLE. Morning, Mr McCallister, sir! Bright and early.

[CONCERNED] Is that all? Or has there been some trouble

BLEEP.
David McCallister. Blue Forgotten Planet executive producer.

10. INT. PRODUCTION GALLERY. COMPOUND
AS DAVID AND ATHERTON ENTER.
Hi. You’re not gonna believe how fantastic this footage is.
[PREOCCUPIED] That's... great.
[PICKING UP ON IT] Listen, what’s been going—?
They’re all waiting for you, David. Sat-link to all producers worldwide. Last one came online just as you touched down. Sergeant, haven’t you got something important to do?
[TAKEN ABACK] Ellen?
PAUSE.
Er.. yeah... yeah, I guess I have, after all the trouble.
Is anyone going to tell me what exactly is—? [going on?]
Thanks.
[LINGERING] I’1ll leave you two to a nice little cosy chat, then.
OPENS AND CLOSES AS ATHERTON LEAVES.
So.. are you going to tell me?
Er, tell you what?
What happened while I was away. Ellen?
I never know if you’re going to come back, David.
Blue Forgotten Planet — by Nicholas Briggs. Page 14
What? Ellen, look, just tell me—
BUZZ.
Look, are you going to do your conference or not? Satellite time’s a bit limited at the moment.
Is it now? Are you okay? Have the meds been getting through?
[A LONG SIGH] People are waiting, David. You need to do
this conference chat, yeah?
Yeah... Okay, okay... Visual on everyone?
Er.. yeah. We’ve got visual.
BEING FLICKED. HE SITS.
You’d better switch me on, then.
CLICK OF SWITCH.
You’re on.
Er.. hello! Good morning, people. This is the beginning of the big one. The turning point for us all. So listen carefully and feel free to get very, very excited.
SPEECH CONTINUES AT BEGINNING OF PART 2

11. EXT. SOLENT BASIN.
FOOTSTEPS OF DOCTOR AND CHARLEY APPROACH ON SAND. THEY COME TO A HALT.
MILA/CHARLEY: [AWE] Oh my God...
PAUSE. THE EERIE WIND WHIPS AROUND A BIT.
I wonder what caused it.
MILA/CHARLEY : Must be a few miles across...
And relatively recent, I’d say.
MILA/CHARLEY : How recent?

Ooh, within a decade... or so. But what makes a crater this big? Can’t be a meteorite impact. Not unless we’re in the middle of an impact winter... and the sky’s too clear for that.. And although it’s fairly cold, it’s not that cold.
MILA/CHARLEY: Um?
I think it was some sort of chemical explosion.
MILA/CHARLEY: Have you noticed—?
[FRUSTRATED, TO HIMSELF ] Where are we? I don’t recognize this.
MILA/CHARLEY : So, definitely not Earth, then?
Probably not. What were you asking me?
MILA/CHARLEY: Oh... over there in the woods, look. Fires.
Blue Forgotten Planet — by Nicholas Briggs. Page 16
Fires? And they’re moving.
MILA/CHARLEY : Coming towards us.. What’s going on?
Blue Forgotten Planet — by Nicholas Briggs. Page 17
12. INT. COMPOUND. SECURITY POST.
HUM OF MONITORS.
So, come on, Sergeant. Tell me.
Ah, Ellen hasn’t told you yet, then?
Told me what? No, she hasn’t, evidently! She snuck off somewhere during my sat-link. So?
Er.. well, there’s something a bit more urgent I’d like you to have a look at.
More urgent than what?
FLICK OF SWITCHES. SCREEN BLEEPS.
See that?
It’s... a satellite image of the Solent Basin, isn’t it?
That’s right, sir. Just a few miles south of here. Live image. Thought I’d make use of our alignment time. Now, if we zoom ina bit.
What am I looking for?
I told you we had patrols out, didn’t I?
You did, yes.
They’ve reported quite a bit of movement. And now... see, Foresters heading south into the basin, towards the Fawley Crater.
What would they be—? [doing that for?]
Blue Forgotten Planet — by Nicholas Briggs. Page 18
No idea. That’s why I ordered the satellite view. But you see here... a whole party of them, flaming torches and all.
Heading towards... what’s that? A shed or something?
Dunno. But someone put it there tonight.
Foresters?
I don’t think so. But maybe... [AS HE ADJUSTS THE VIEW]
ZOOMING IN SOUND.
Who are they?
No idea. Only two of them so far, man and woman, and they’re wandering around like lost sheep. But if they’re foreigners, I don’t fancy their chances if Driscoll’s lot get hold of them.
Get the helicopter fired up.
Blue Forgotten Planet — by Nicholas Briggs. Page 19
13. EXT. SOLENT BASIN.
A torchlight parade?
MILA/CHARLEY : I’m counting well over a hundred of them...
Not a pleasant image either... I’m thinking ‘Burn the witch’?
MILA/CHARLEY: Great.
[AGGRESSIVE, SHOUTING FROM QUITE A WAY OFF] Who are you? What you here?
MILA/CHARLEY : [SOTTO] Not sounding very friendly, is he?
[SOTTO] We’ll never make it back to the TARDIS. They could easily cut us off. So let’s just be polite. [SHOUTING] Er... I’m afraid we’ve lost our way. Perhaps you could help!?!
You from compound?!?

[SOTTO] Good question.

15. INT. PRODUCTION GALLERY. COMPOUND.
[FLABBERGHASTED] So what are you telling me, Ellen? You mean you let them into the compound?
No.. I mean, not them, just... It’s just that—
Oh... of course, Ed Driscoll! You just let him in and surprise-surprise all his mates came with him? Is that it?
I... Look, he said—
What? That he still loves you? That he wanted a tender moment? Just to hold hands? I mean, what? Are you really that naive, Ellen? [BEAT] Sorry. I’m sorry. It’s just that...
PAUSE. Don’t I mean anything to you?
He was the father of my daughter, David!
I know that, but—

I can’t just switch off from that! She died out there! Living with the Foresters. Exposed to the elements, grubbing around for food, while we were here, living a privileged life with medical supplies and—
Didn’t Atherton and his people try to stop them?
There were too many. It would’ve been a blood bath. Or would you’ve preferred it if I’d let Atherton hit the button and blow us all up? [BEAT] So we let them take the stuff and go.

God, Ellen. You know supplies of the vaccine are limited. Do we have any of it left? [CLEARLY NOT.
HE SIGHES] What a mess. Why the hell didn’t you tell me this earlier?
[LOADED] I didn’t think your ‘chums’ would be too happy.
We don’t keep secrets from them, Ellen. We’re working with them! And they’re working with us.
Are they?
Oh, now come on! This is Driscoll’s nonsense, isn’t it? Why the hell would you listen to—?
DESCENDING OUTSIDE.

18. INT. DRISCOLL’S TENT.

Good dog.
IT MAKES A NASTY, SNAPPING SOUND.
Ah, not good dog. Not good to me anyway. You know, I once had a dog. We were good friends. His bark could be worse than his bite. I wonder if that applies to you. Perhaps we could be friends.

[ENTERING] Bess knows who master is. Don’t stand no nonsense. Have your leg off.
Charming.

[CHARMING] Impeccable reasoning, Mr... ?

[THREAT] I do askin’. What they call you?

‘Doctor’? Were doctors. Before Bad Times.
Bad Times?
We took their stuff. No good to us. Don’t make no sense.
Um... what stuff did you take?
[SUDDENLY VIOLENTLY ANGRY] I told you, I’m askin’, not you!
Sorry... sorry. Ask away.
PAUSE.
Clever man... I see that. You with Callister’s lot in compound?

Channel? No, I’m not from... across the channel.

I don’t know where I am.
SUDDENLY GRABS THE DOCTOR. BESS IS GROWLING.

If you clever. You could help.

IS JUST FINISHING SIPPING SOME TEA. SHE PUTS A

MILA/CHARLEY: Yes—?

[TERSE] She asked if this was Earth. Excuse me, I’ve got some editing to do.
SCRAPES AND SHE LEAVES. DOOR CLOSING BEHIND HER.
‘Earth’?
I sense a little tension in the air.
Well you might. I’m needed back in the security post.
Okay, sergeant.

[TO CHARLEY, INTRIGUED] So... Are you... a space traveller?
MILA/CHARLEY: Er... why would you think that?

MILA/CHARLEY : Good point. [DIVERTING] What’s that you’ve got there?
BURBLE OF BIO-SCANNER.

MILA/CHARLEY: And you’re scanning me?
I am.
MILA/CHARLEY: Why?
Because you’re a mystery.
Blue Forgotten Planet — by Nicholas Briggs. Page 32
MILA/CHARLEY:

All right, all right! [IN NEARLY ONE BREATH] The Doctor and I landed here earlier this morning, when it was still dark, but his instruments were on the blink, so we didn’t know where we were. So.. is this Earth?
Yes, this is Earth, Charlotte Pollard. The Blue Forgotten Planet.
Blue Forgotten Planet — by Nicholas Briggs. Page 33
20. INT. VIYRAN VESSEL. CONTROL AREA.
TICKS OVER.
Begin revival.
SURGES. A HISS AS A VIYRAN ‘COFFIN’ SLIDES OPEN.
Cryo-pod unsealing.
[GASPS AS SHE WAKES ]
Charlotte Pollard. You are awake.
[GROGGY, LIKE A HANGOVER] Er... thanks. You’re too kind. [A THOUGHT] Wait a minute... does this mean you’ve found him?
PAUSE.
You said you’d wake me again if you found him. The Doctor.
PAUSE.
Come on. That’s why I agreed to help you. Why I went on those ‘little missions’ for you. So? Have you? Have you found him?
We have received a cellular scan from the planet we are orbiting. We may need to conduct tests on non-cryogenic tissue.
Oh, now come on, you promised me—

READ-OUT, ANIMATED GRAPHICS SOUND.
Look, I’ve told you before that I don’t understand your hieroglyphics—
Blue Forgotten Planet — by Nicholas Briggs.
Observe the second scan.
First, second, it’s all Greek to me.
The second is a cellular scan of you.
How interesting! What am I supposed— ?[STOPS IN TRACKS] Oh. It’s the same. It’s a copy of me.
Precisely. Your double.
[ANGRY] Mila!
Page 34

21. INT. PRODUCTION GALLERY. COMPOUND.
MILA/CHARLEY : So what do these scans of me say?
I’ve no idea.
MILA/CHARLEY: Oh. Why not?
We transmit the results for analysis.
MILA/CHARLEY : Transmit? Where to?
Into orbit.
MILA/CHARLEY : You've got spaceships in orbit?

CHARLEY: Why not? You woke me up because you wanted my help. So, come on, tell us... tell us both what you’re actually up to!
DOCTOR WHO: Blue Forgotten Planet — by Nicholas Briggs. Page 79
ATHERTON: Don’t move!
GUNS: COCK.
DOCTOR: All right, all right. We’re not moving.
DRISCOLL: Atherton, we’ve come to help y—
ATHERTON: Shut it!!! Shut it!!! Men, fire! Kill them!!!
ELLEN: No! Atherton! Can’t you see we’ve got the meds?
ATHERTON: Wha... ? Meds?
DOCTOR: Yes, don’t you remember?
ATHERTON: Shut it!!!
ELLEN: Here.. look. Remember, I made you stand by and let Driscoll take them.
ATHERTON: Driscoll! He walked out on us!
ELLEN: Yes, but he’s back. We’re all back. And we’ve brought the meds with us.. so the Foresters can’t get them.
ATHERTON: [CONFUSED, UNCERTAIN GRUNTS]
DRISCOLL: [SOTTO] He’s too far gone.
DOCTOR: [SOTTO] I don’t think so. I’m assuming everyone in the compound has been receiving the vaccine for some time?
ELLEN: [SOTTO] That’s true, Doctor, yes, years.
DOCTOR WHO: Blue Forgotten Planet — by Nicholas Briggs. Page 80
DOCTOR: [SOTTO] Then the vaccine may have built up a cumulative resistance against whatever chemical imbalance in the brain has caused this ‘madness’. And look... they still know how to hold and presumably use their guns. So, I think there’s just a chance that—
ATHERTON: Give me meds! Give it me!
ELLEN: Here.
SHE: HANDS IT OVER.
ATHERTON: I will... inject!
INJECTOR: INJECTS.
INJECTOR: Aaargh!
DOCTOR WHO: Blue Forgotten Planet — by Nicholas Briggs. Page 81
VIYRAN: SCANNER IS BLEEPING.
CHARLEY: [SOTTO] Notice how we’re not getting any answers?
DAVID: [SOTTO] What’s that? I recognize that.
CHARLEY: [SOTTO] What? David, no—!
FOOTSTEPS: AS HE MOVES FORWARD.
DAVID: [ALOUD] There’s a satellite view of my compound on this screen! Listen to me! Have you seen this?
VIYRAN: Yes. It is a view from this ship’s orbital position.
DAVID: But... what’s all this movement? Here.
VIYRAN: APPROACHES.
VIYRAN: The people you call ‘Foresters’. There are many thousands of them moving towards your compound with hostile intent.
DAVID: But... why?
VIYRAN: That does not concern us.
DAVID: Does not concern... ? But why not? Can’t you intervene? You must have the power to intervene... even if the madness is all your fault! If the Foresters attack the compound, Atherton and his men will open fire. There’ll be a terrible loss of life. We can’t just sit here and allow that—
VIYRAN: The information you have supplied to us makes intervention unnecessary.
CHARLEY: The cameras they gave you have built-in bio-scanners.
DOCTOR WHO: Blue Forgotten Planet — by Nicholas Briggs. Page 82
DAVID: What? Built-in... ? What are you talking about?
CHARLEY: The Blue Forgotten Planet project isn’t a charity appeal, David. They wanted shots of every human face to.. well... [SHE STOPS]
VIYRAN: You may continue, Charlotte. The sample of scans David has given us is enough information to make a conclusion.
CHARLEY: No! You can’t give up yet. What about me? And Mila? You haven’t explained that yet.
VIYRAN: We will solve that problem in due course.
CHARLEY: But the Doctor’s down there, you can’t—
VIYRAN: The Doctor has chosen to involve himself. We cannot answer for him.
DAVID: Look, I don’t understand what’s going on here. Charlotte, what are they saying? What are you talking about?
VIYRAN: You may explain.
CHARLEY: [ENRAGED] May I? Oh, thanks! I1/’11 make it short then, shall I?
DAVID: Charlotte? What is it? Tell me.
CHARLEY: I think... [SHE CAN BARELY BRING HERSELF TO SAY IT] I think the Viyrans are going to wipe out the human race.
CHARLEY: CRASH IN CLOSING THEME.
DOCTOR WHO: Blue Forgotten Planet — by Nicholas Briggs. Page 83

48. EXT. COMPOUND.
THE SOUND OF THOUSANDS OF FOOTSTEPS THROUGH UNDERGROWTH.
THE LOW, ANGRY MOAN OF THE APPROACHING FORESTERS.
[DISTORT]
This is Blue Forgotten Base One to all bases. We need your urgent help. Our compound is under siege. We have thousands of unvaccinated survivors surrounding us. We fear for our lives. Over.
HISS, FADE OUT...
Here they come, Sarge!
Stand by to open fire!
CRASH IN OPENING THEME.
Blue Forgotten Planet — by Nicholas Briggs. Page 84
49. EXT. COMPOUND.
COCKING OF GUNS.
Take aim!
Giving Atherton and his soldiers the injections may have cured them of the ‘madness’... but now we know they were just bloodthirsty killers all along.
Sergeant, there has to be another solution!
Well, I’m open to suggestions, Doctor, but right now I can see over a thousand zombies heading straight at us.
They’re not zombies! They’re human beings like you and me.
Like you, maybe, Driscoll, but not like us. [ALOUD] Wait for the order to fire! Mark your targets and keep a grip of yourselves!
Atherton! Ellen is contacting the other survival bases, we have to wait until—
They won’t help us! They won’t get here in time! Face it, Doctor! We’re on our own.
Blue Forgotten Planet — by Nicholas Briggs. Page 85
50. INT. VIYRAN SHIP. CONTROL CENTRE.
But I don’t understand, you said you came to Earth to help us.
We have helped you. But now the help must stop.
But why?
Because of their mission, David. Their mission to wipe out all trace of the Amethyst viruses.
Amethyst... ? What are Amethyst viruses? You mean the madness is a virus?
No.. That was their attempt at a cure. And it went wrong.
What? How could the madness be a cure... a cure for what?
Blue Forgotten Planet — by Nicholas Briggs. Page 86
51. EXT. COMPOUND.
AS ELLEN RUSHES UP TO JOIN THEM.
[OUT OF BREATH] It’s no good... it’s no good. None of the bases can spare any help. They’re all running low on meds and—
What did I tell you, Doctor?
Outer perimeter explosives now primed, Sarge!
We've got to contact the Viyrans.
The Viyrans? But how? And what will they do anyway?
Give me the detonator.
Sarge.
You can’t just blow them up!
Just watch me. We detonate the outer perimeter charges. Cut their numbers down, maybe even scare them off.
Listen to me! The Viyrans came to Earth to help you. There’s no reason why they won’t help you now.
Blue Forgotten Planet — by Nicholas Briggs. Page 87
52. INT. VIYRAN SHIP. CONTROL CENTRE.
We cannot help Mankind now. We detected one particle per human of the 001 Variant of Amethyst Icosahedral Plasmid Virus 9007/41.
What does that mean?
We launched a meson radiation disseminator to destroy that particle in every human being. We did not foresee the side effect.
Side effect?
The ‘madness’, David. The radiation caused some kind of massive chemical imbalance... somehow the result was that the human race had civilization wiped clean from its collective brains.
Blue Forgotten Planet — by Nicholas Briggs. Page 88
53. EXT. COMPOUND.
Only David ever called them, I don’t know how—
Take me to the transmitter array.

It’s too late for all that, Doctor. The only solution is to detonate the perimeter charges. If they get through that, we pick as many off as we can. If they’re still coming at us after that, we retreat to our dug-outs in the East and detonate the charges in the compound.
Sergeant Atherton, you must see that this is utterly barbaric.
As barbaric as that lot ripping us to pieces? [ALOUD] Stand by, people! Stand by!
Ed, you’ve got to buy us some time.
How?
You said they’re coming here because of you—
They’re coming here because of the vaccine!
There isn’t any left!
But they’re not going to understand that!
Can’t you speak to them, Ed? Won’t they recognize you? It might at least slow them down.
So that you have time to talk to the Viyrans? You really think they’1ll listen?
Isn’t it worth a try, Ed?
Blue Forgotten Planet — by Nicholas Briggs. Page 89
They only ever wanted to talk to their pet McCallister.
Well, they may talk to me. I’ve met them before. Come on, Ed, will you do it?

I don’t know... Look at them out there. You don’t know what it’s like, Doctor. When you’ve got the madness... nothing makes much sense any more. You just feel angry... and afraid. And.. well, I made these people angry about the Compound, didn’t I? In away, this is my fault.
I don’t know exactly whose fault all this is, Ed, but it isn’t yours. This whole situation is a mess... and one
that I suspect should not be happening at all.
What’s that supposed to mean?
They've reached the perimeter, Sarge!
Right, that’s it!
No! I’11 go.
What?
Let me try!
Good man.
I’1ll give it my best shot. You’d better get to work on that transmitter, Doctor.
Don’t take any unnecessary risks, Mr Driscoll.
Good luck, Ed.
ED AND ELLEN KISS.
Blue Forgotten Planet — by Nicholas Briggs. Page 90
Go with the Doctor. If things go badly—
No—
Don’t look back. Keep running. I love you.
I know. I love you too.
Come on, Ellen.
THEY DASH OFF.
So.. Will you let me through, Atherton?
Driscoll, they’1ll tear you to pieces—
No, they’1l remember me. I’m sure they will. I hope they will. Give me a chance, Atherton. What do you say?
Blue Forgotten Planet — by Nicholas Briggs. Page 91
54. INT. VIYRAN SHIP. CONTROL CENTRE.
All right, so it’s all your fault! And now you’re just going to eradicate us to cover up the mistake?
If the viruses cannot be eliminated, then the carriers themselves must be eliminated. It is a small price to pay for expunging all knowledge of the viruses.
A small price?!? You’re not the ones paying it.
We must follow our mission imperatives. That is why we were summoned.
But why did you bother to lie to us about the Blue Forgotten Planet project... filming every human face? Were you just mocking us? Is that part of your mission?
We needed to make a more detailed scan to assess the results of the meson radiation treatment.
But you haven’t scanned every human being on Earth yet.
Blue Forgotten Planet — by Nicholas Briggs. Page 92
55. EXT. COMPOUND.
You think he’1ll stop them?
Dunno... but he’s a braver man than me. Be ready to open fire if they rush him.
[IN THE DISTANCE] Fellow Foresters! You know me! I am Driscoll! You know me and you trust me!
My God... they’ve stopped.
[IN THE DISTANCE] I am one of you! You can trust me!
CROSS-FADE TO OPPOSITE PERSPECTIVE, CLOSE TO DRISCOLL.
I know you’re angry. I understand. I feel that anger too! You’ve seen how angry I’ve been before! But these people here.. they mean you no harm! It isn’t their fault!
Blue Forgotten Planet — by Nicholas Briggs. Page 93
56. INT. VIYRAN SHIP.
The sample is comprehensive enough. No further evidence is needed.
What?
What are they saying?
All the scans received so far show that the virus particle is still present in the human race. And now,
our schedule demands that we move on to the next stage of the mission.
What? So you’ve just run out of time! You can’t be bothered to try again?!?
There is no need.
No need? Not even to save—?
STATIC.
[HEAVILY DISTORTED] Hello! Hello! Come in, please!
Doctor? Doctor, is that you?
[HEAVILY DISTORTED] Do you hear me? This is the Doctor. Remember me? Hello!
Well, aren’t you going to answer him?
There is no need.
I have a need! Ido! And I’ve done a lot for you over the past few millennia. You know that! You couldn’t have completed your mission on some of the planets you’ve been to if it weren’t for me!
Blue Forgotten Planet — by Nicholas Briggs. Page 94
What did you do for them?
That is not relevant at this time.

Hello? Hello! We are beaming our signal directly into orbit. Can you hear me? Please.. Come in. We are boosting the signal as much as we can. There is an emergency situation down here. We need your help.
[OVERLAP IN POST-PRODUCTION]
It’s relevant to me! You promised you’d let me know if you ever found him! Well, you’ve found him.. and I at least want to speak to him, before you do whatever you’re going to do.
MOVING AROUND. CONTROLS BEING OPERATED.
What are they doing?
Preparing to ‘expunge’ the human race, probably— Let me speak to the Doctor!
The disseminator is now being prepared.
What disseminator?
A disseminator that will impact on Earth and release radiation which will cleanse the planet of the human race.
‘Cleanse’? This is a nightmare.
In the time remaining, you may speak to the Doctor.
BLEEP.
Doctor-Doctor-it’s-me!
Blue Forgotten Planet — by Nicholas Briggs. Page 95
57. INT. COMPOUND BUILDING.
Charley? Charley, can you hear me?
[DISTORT] Of course I can hear you, I’m on the Viyran ship. Just listen to me—
Wait a minute, Charley, I have to speak to the Viyrans. They have to help us. There are thousands of—
[DISTORT] Doctor, they know all that! We can see it from up here, but they’re not going to help you.
What?
Oh no. I knew it.
Sssh! Why not?
[DISTORT] It’s too complicated to explain now, but you’ve got to listen to me. Get to the TARDIS! Now! Get to it as fast as possible and leave Earth!
Charley, I can’t just—
[DISTORT] They’re going to destroy the human race!
What? Why—?
[DISTORT] Oh Doctor, does it matter why? They’re going to do it and they’re going to do it any minute now, so get out of there!
How? How are they going to destroy the human—?
[DISTORT] It’s too late for you to do anything about—
Blue Forgotten Planet — by Nicholas Briggs. Page 96
It’s never too late, Charley!
[DISTORT] Oh Doctor, I’ve missed you. I’ve missed you so much. But you’ve got to trust me. I know the Viyrans.
[CONFUSED] You know—?
[DISTORT] I know what they’re capable of, and there’s nothing you can do to stop them. Please, you’ve got to save yourself and—
STATIC.
Charley? Charley!
There’s no signal. She’s been cut off.
What did she mean?
She meant we’re dead—
[PUZZLED] No... ‘I know the Viyrans... I know what they’re capable of’.
Does that matter? Looks like nothing matters—
Helicopter! Can you pilot it?
EXPLOSION IN THE DISTANCE.
Oh no. [RUNNING OUT] Ed! Ed!
OPENS.
CUT TO...
Blue Forgotten Planet — by Nicholas Briggs.
58. EXT. COMPOUND.
Page 97
EXPLOSION. THE SOUND OF THE FORESTERS SCREAMING
AND SHOUTING, ADVANCING.
Ed!!!
[IN THE DISTANCE] Open fire!!!
AUTOMATIC GUNFIRE FOR THIRTY GUNS. DRISCOLL’S FOOTSTEPS RUN UP TO US ON CONCRETE.
[OUT OF BREATH] It was no good! No good! I thought
they were gonna listen, and then—
You did your best, Ed—
[SCORN] Yeah, and now Atherton’s doing his.
It doesn’t matter, Ed. Nothing matters now.
What? Doctor, did you get through to—
The Viyrans are gonna kill us all—
What?
We've got to get into your helicopter.
What good will that do?
Can either of you pilot it? Never mind, I’11 work out! Quickly! Follow me! Come on!
THEY DASH OFF.
[IN THE DISTANCE] Fall back! Fall back!
ae
Blue Forgotten Planet — by Nicholas Briggs. Page 98
CONTINUES. THE FORESTERS SURGE EVER FORWARD, A WALL OF VOCAL SOUND — CRIES AND SCREAMS OF RAGE. HOLD ON
FOR A FEW SECONDS, THEN CROSS-FADE IT INTO THE MID- DISTANCE, BUT IT’S STILL LOUD!
DOOR OPENS.
Quickly, get in the helicopter! Get in!
FOOTSTEPS OF ATHERTON RUN UP.
What the hell are you people doing?
Trying to save your lives! Get in, Sergeant! And get as many of your men as— Look out!
A CROWD OF FORESTERS CRY OUT WITH INSANE ANGER AS THEY APPROACH, CHARGING.
ATHERTON’S GUN FIRES.
THE FORESTER’S SCREAM AND DIE.
I’1ll cover you, Doctor! Go! Go now! We’1ll use the explosives!
AGAIN.
[BREATHLESS, TERRIFIED] There’s too many of ‘em, Sarge! We’ll never— Aaaargh!
SET UPON HIM AND KILL HIM.
Noooo!!!
BLASTS AWAY.
CUT TO...
Blue Forgotten Planet — by Nicholas Briggs. Page 99
59. INT. HELICOPTER.
SLAMS SHUT. THE MAYHEM OF THE BATTLE ONLY SLIGHTLY MUFFLED.
It’s like a vision of hell out there. No time to lose.
HE IS SITTING HIMSELF DOWN IN THE COCKPIT, SWITCHING
ETC.
Doctor, where are you going to take us?
Is it true that the Viyrans said they’re going to wipe us out? Why?
My friend Charley told me, so I believe her. And I’ve no idea why they’re doing it.. but I intend to find out—and stop them! Hold tight.
THE HELICOPTER ENGINES GUN INTO LIFE.
CUT TO EXTERIOR PERSPECTIVE OF THE TERRIBLE BATTLE, WITH THE HELICOPTER RISING UP ABOVE IT.
Blue Forgotten Planet — by Nicholas Briggs. Page 100
60. INT. VIYRAN SHIP.
You've got to stop and think! You’ve got to! I’m not infected with this virus particle and I’m human! Ask yourself why not!
Your double is not infected either.
What?
And she is a completely perfect copy of you, down to the last cell. We will analyse this for future reference.
What about me?
What about you?
I’m human. Do I have this virus particle in me?
You do.
So... you’re going to ‘expunge’ me too?
You will be frozen for future reference. You may prove useful to us at a future stage of our mission. The cleansing disseminator is now prepared.
Please, you’ve got to reconsider. For my sake! I’ve helped you—

Charlotte Pollard and David McCallister, we bear you no ill feeling whatsoever. We bear the human race no ill feeling. But our duty is to the safety of the universe and the eradication of all viruses resulting from the Amethyst Catastrophe. Launching disseminator.
No!
THE DISSEMINATOR LAUNCHES, WITH A HUGE WHOOSH.
Blue Forgotten Planet — by Nicholas Briggs. Page 101
61. EXT. SOLENT BASIN.
THE HELICOPTER LANDS. THE SOUNDS OF THE BATTLE ARE AUDIBLE IN THE DISTANCE.
DOORS OPEN. FOOTSTEPS CLAMBER OUT ONTO THE
SURFACE. THEY KEEP MOVING.
Quickly now.
What is that thing?
I remember it, when I first saw you—
It’s my ship, the TARDIS.
JANGLE OF TARDIS KEY.
STOP.
INTO LOCK.
SOUND OF MISSILE (THE DISSEMINATOR) FLYING EVER CLOSER.
You hear that?
There! What is that? Looks like... like a missile or—
It’s the Viyrans, isn’t it? That’s them killing us.
Not if I can help it. Come on, inside!
OPENS. THEY DASH IN.
Blue Forgotten Planet — by Nicholas Briggs. Page 102
INT. TARDIS.
AS THEY HURRIEDLY ENTER.
CLOSING.
What? I don’t get it.. we just walked into—
This doesn’t make sense, it’s—
Brace yourselves, please.
BURBLE. TARDIS ENGINES ENGAGE.
Are we taking off or something?
In a manner of speaking.
BLEEPING OF A HARSH SIGNAL.
Now... I wonder what that is.. As if I didn’t know. Aha, it’s a transmission from the Viyran ship to... that missile!
LURCHES. THEY ALL CRY OUT.
Come on, old girl! I know you had a rough ride through that radiation on your way to Earth, but you’ve had ample time to recuperate— Argh!
A CIRCUIT BLOWS.
Is this thing safe?
Usually! But she’s been through a lot, lately. Oh no! [DISMAYED] We’re slipping back and forth in time! [SUDDENLY CONFIDENT] Which gives me an idea!
Blue Forgotten Planet — by Nicholas Briggs. Page 103
62. INT. VIYRAN SHIP.
SLIDE OPEN.
You will now be frozen. Step into the cryogenic pods,
please.
Is it over? Have you done it?
Can they have really wiped out the whole human race so quickly?
Believe me, they could do it, David. Well?
BLEEP.
Disseminator has impacted. Radiation release commences...
A NEGATIVE BLEEP.
Sounds like something’s gone wrong.
BLEEP AGAIN.
[TO DAVID, SOTTO] I think you’re right.
Radiation release transmission negative.
What’s gone wrong? Something broken?
The dissemination command transmission is being jammed.
BURBLE OF READ-OUTS. There is temporal distortion.
Temporal... ? It’s the Doctor, it’s got to be!
How do you know that?
Blue Forgotten Planet — by Nicholas Briggs. Page 104
Trust me. [TO VIYRANS] The Doctor is stopping you.
You will be frozen. Enter your pods, now.
ADVANCE.
He'll be on his way here now. I know it.. Argh... get off
me!
Please... argh, no!
THE POD LIDS SEAL. THEIR VOICES ARE NOW DISTORTED THROUGH THE ‘GLASS COFFINS’.
Charlotte?
Yes?
They’ve done this to you before, haven’t they?
More times than I care to remember.
Does it hurt?
Er... sort of.
FADE IN THE VERY BEGINNING OF THE TARDIS MATERIALIZATION.
Commence cryogenic freezing.
Wait a minute! That sound! I recognize that sound!
FREEZING EFFECT BEGINS.
[BEING FROZEN] It’s... getting cold... I.. I..
MATERIALIZATION SOUND IS GETTING LOUDER.
Blue Forgotten Planet — by Nicholas Briggs. Page 105
[STARTING TO FREEZE] It’s... it’s.. the TARDIS! Doctor!
BLEEP, BLEEP. FINAL HISSSSSS-ST!
Cryogenic freezing complete. Levitate cryo-pods.
CRYO-PODS HUM AS THEY LEVITATE.
Despatch to storage areas.
HUM OFF INTO DISTANCE AND THROUGH DOORS, WHICH CLOSE
THEM.
Intruding craft is materializing. All security measures
have failed.
MATERIALIZATION COMPLETES.
Blue Forgotten Planet — by Nicholas Briggs. Page 106
63. INT. TARDIS.
SOUND OF TIME SPHERE COMING FROM CONSOLE.
By Jove, I think I’ve done it. Just about. Yes, percolating nicely in a temporal sort of way. I hope.
I’m guessing you mean something clever... judging by the technology you’ve got in this thing. Doctor, what exactly—?
You've stopped the Viyrans from killing everybody, you mean?
I think so... for now. And not only that... Let’s have a look at the scanner.
OPERATES.
Viyrans!
So that’s what they look like.
Yes. I’ve managed to land us on their ship. Quite a tricky manoeuvre, actually. You two stay here. I’m going to have a word with them.
Is that a good idea?
They did just try to wipe out the human race.
Ah, but I’m not human. Won’t be long... hopefully.
OPENS.
Blue Forgotten Planet — by Nicholas Briggs. Page 107
64. INT. VIYRAN SHIP.
DOOR OPENS. DOCTOR EXITS TARDIS.
What have you done, Doctor?
Yes, and it’s nice to see you again too. I might ask the same of you.
Our mission is to remove all trace of the Amethyst viruses released in the explosion you failed to prevent—
I hope you’re not attempting to implicate me? It was the Daleks who—
All knowledge of the viruses must be expunged. It must be as if they had never existed.
I see... So you’re chasing around the universe, sniffing out every single virus that got scattered throughout time and space? That’s going to be more than several lifetimes’ work.
It is why we were summoned. What are you doing to our dissemination signal?
‘Dissemination signal’? Oh, that’s the transmission you were sending to that projectile you rather rashly launched at Earth. What’s in the projectile, by the way?
Radiation designed to cleanse the Earth of the human race.
‘Cleanse’? That’s a rather innocuous-sounding euphemism for genocide. So your deadly radiation can’t be released from the projectile without that transmission?
That is correct. How have you prevented that signal from reaching the disseminator?
Blue Forgotten Planet — by Nicholas Briggs. Page 108
Ooh, trade secret, I’m afraid. Where’s Charley?
Both Charlotte Pollards have been frozen for future analysis—
‘Both’?
. when our schedule allows.
What do you mean, ‘both Charlotte Pollards’?
There are two Charlotte Pollards.
Two? No. I don’t understand.
There are two. Identical in every way.
Show them to me.
You must stop jamming our dissemination signal.
Show me Charlotte and I might just think about it. Might.
You must guarantee the release of the signal.
No guarantees. And you must show me why you consider it necessary to wipe out the human race.
It is part of our mission.
You said your mission is to remove all trace of the Amethyst viruses, does that often involve wiping out entire races?
Not often.
Blue Forgotten Planet — by Nicholas Briggs. Page 109
Not... ? How often?
In our mission so far, we have located and expunged three million, four hundred and thirty-six thousand Amethyst viruses. In only five cases has it been necessary to wipe out an entire race.
[JAW DROPPING] Only five...
I will take you to see the Charlotte Pollards. Follow
me.
FOOTSTEPS. DOCTOR’S FOLLOW. DOOR OPENS.
Blue Forgotten Planet — by Nicholas Briggs. Page 110
65. INT. TARDIS.
SHIP DOOR CLOSES ON SCANNER DISTORT.
SPHERE EFFECT BURBLING AWAY TO ITSELF.
I don’t get it. Two of them?
Neither do I, Ed. And you know what? I don’t care, as long as the Doctor doesn’t release their signal. As long as whatever clever thing this is here keeps going.
It’s like we’re nothing to them, isn’t it? To the Viyrans. Like we’re just microbes in a lab.
I’ve never trusted them. Never.
Even when your precious McCallister devoted his life to them?
David was just trying to do what he thought was best for all of us.
Didn’t turn out that way, though, did it?
SPHERE EFFECT FIZZES, THE PITCH WAVERING.
Hey, what’s it doing?
I dunno, but that doesn’t sound right to me—
FIZZ. SPARKS SHOWER.
Woah— get back!
Blue Forgotten Planet — by Nicholas Briggs. Page 111
66. INT. VIYRAN SHIP. CORRIDOR/CRYO CHAMBER.
OPENS. FOOTSTEPS OF THE DOCTOR AND THE VIYRAN.
Something’s changed, hasn’t it?
I do not understand you, Doctor.
You were helping the humans... They thought you were their saviours. Then suddenly, you decided to wipe them out. Why?
We have arrived.
OPENS. THEY WALK THROUGH INTO THE CRYO CHAMBER.
CHAMBER WITH RHYTHMIC HUMMING AND HISSING.
BLEEPS OF CONTROLS BEING OPERATED.
I am selecting the most recently frozen pods.
A POD UNLOCKS AND EMERGES.
How many people have you got frozen here?
There are beings from all over the universe frozen in this chamber.
Why?
They are of use to us in our mission.
You mean you use them as lab rats.
LOCKS INTO PLACE. Who’s this?
This is David McCallister, an infected human.
AS HE’S RESUSCITATED.
Blue Forgotten Planet — by Nicholas Briggs. Page 112
[INSIDE POD] [GROANS, WAKING] What’s going on?
As we failed to cure this virus, we are keeping him as a specimen. Long term research may find a cure, which may prove useful if we discover a recurrence of this virus.
And what virus would that be?
The 001 Variant of Amethyst Icosahedral Plasmid Virus 9007/41.
